definition:
**Legendre Symbol.**\
Let $p$ be an odd prime. The *Legendre symbol*
$\left(\frac{a}{p}\right)$ or $(a|p)$ is defined as:
$$\left(\frac{a}{p}\right) =
\begin{cases}
1 &\text{if }a \text{ is a quadratic residue }\pmod{p}\\
-1 &\text{if }a \text{ is a quadratic nonresidue }\pmod{p}\\
0 & \text{if } p \text{ divides }a
\end{cases}$$

The Legendre symbol can be computed by means of Euler’s criterion or
Gauss’ lemma.

Generalizations of this symbol are the Jacobi Symbol and the Kronecker
symbol.
